## Label Application Rules

```
Title Contains          â†’  Label Applied
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
[Spark] or spark:       â†’  spark
[Bug] or bug:           â†’  bug
[Feature] or feature:   â†’  feature
[Docs] or documentation â†’  documentation
[Pages] or github pages â†’  github-pages
[Automation] or workflowâ†’  automation
[Project Management]    â†’  project-management
[Contributor Experience]â†’  contributor-experience
[Knowledge Base]/[SDLC] â†’  knowledge-base
[Templates] or [Labels] â†’  templates
(No match & new issue)  â†’  triage
```


## Key

- **ğŸ’¡ Spark**: New idea or concept
- **ğŸ› Bug**: Something broken
- **âœ¨ Feature**: New functionality
- **ğŸ“š Docs**: Documentation
- **âš™ï¸ Setup**: Repository configuration
- **ğŸ¤– Automation**: Workflow/action
- **ğŸ“Š Project**: Project board
- **ğŸ·ï¸ Label**: Issue label
- **ğŸ’¬ Discussion**: Community discussion
- **ğŸ‘€ Review**: Code review
- **ğŸ§ª Test**: Testing phase
- **ğŸš€ Deploy**: Deployment
- **ğŸ”§ Maintain**: Maintenance

---

**Note**: These diagrams are conceptual representations. Actual implementation may vary based on repository usage and evolution.
